description: Introduction to basic principles of fluid mechanics and of energy and mass transport with emphasis on applications to living systems and biomedical devices.
name: INTRO TO BIOTRANS PROCES

values.comments:
This class is an introduction to basic principles of fluid mechanics and of energy and mass transport with emphasis on applications to living systems and biomedical devices.

Students thought that the course was “undeniably difficult,” one reason being the lack of partial credit given on exams and quizzes. In particular, quiz averages we around 2/6 for most weeks, due to “little mistakes” on each question. Although they “appreciated the math/physics review at the beginning of the course,” it caused the bulk of course material to be crammed into the second midterm, which was much more difficult than the first midterm or the final. There was too much material to cover, and many felt that the structure and continuity of the course was poor.

Only a few students commented on either Dr. Raj or Dr. Bogen’s teaching. One student felt that Dr. Raj was particularly difficult to understand, while another said that he was “articulate.” One student appreciated that Dr. Bogen helped the class understand the fundamentals of the course material. The two undergraduates were praised for being “very knowledgeable,” and “able to provide good advice on what to expect on quizzes/exams,” having taken the class before. In contrast, the graduate TAs were “very removed from the course.”

This is a required course for BE students in the BSE program, and is intended for the spring semester of junior year.
